ratings.comment: I took AP Stats in high school and earned the full credit, so I regret taking STAT 371. It covered the same material from AP Stats, and my high school teacher did a much better job of explaining the content than a UW professor. I got an easy A in AP, but only managed to get a B for STAT 371, even after putting much effort and time into the course.

Extremely monotone professor. The only thing she does in lecture is read directly off of the notes documents and go through examples that are nothing like what is done in the homework and exams. I am a genuinely smart person and I don't think I had a moment of clarity in that class ever.

She is a disgrace to UW and the Math department. She does a terrible job in explaining, and only reads heavy notes and plug in numbers to complex formulas. I wanted to learn the concepts of stats, but all I learned was formula computations. Worst thing about her is her speech, she would not stop saying uhmm, which has caused me severe migraines.

She does not teach, she reads off the slides and notes. Fell asleep most of the time in her class and learned everything in the SLC, I do not recommend taking a class taught by her unless you're great at stats

I would say I agree with some bad and some good comments. I think Amy is a very nice professor and cares about students, however I am not a fan of her teaching style. Even though she does examples in class, some steps in those examples are not well explained. Exams don't correlate to homework or notes, and homework is insanely time consuming.

I honestly do not understand all of these bad ratings. Go to class, follow her note sheets in word, and use them on all of the exams like you're suppose to. Professor Beyler goes over every single problem with you and shows you how to do them. Yes, the homework is super time consuming, but that is going to be the same across the board.

Professor Beyler is very nice, but she is not a good teacher. I don't know if it is stats 371 or Professor Beyler, but this was the absolute worst experience I have ever had in a math class. It is incredibly difficult to understand Prof. Beyler's lectures for a multitude of reasons, none of which I can detail in under 350 words.

Absolutely terrible experience. I struggled the entire semester. Poor lecturer. Inaccessible virtually. Doesn't help much when you have questions. Discussions were unrelated. 

AVOID THIS INSTRUCTOR IF AT ALL POSSIBLE

Has homework problems that literally have parts A-K or A-W. Longest and most time consuming busywork assignments I have ever been assigned. It sickens me that my tuition pays for her salary, because I would like a big refund. She should be dismissed immediately. I know 2 people that have attempted to k word themselves because of Homework 8.

Worst professor I have had. She is a stain on UW-Madison and should NEVER be considered for tenure and if she has it, then her tenure should be revoked. She does not explain ANYTHING, assigns homework longer than the Iliad, and expects you to write down everything she says in class because you will be quizzed on the specific numbers from class.

She will read directly from her notes and input code during lectures, but she is not very good at explaining "why". While her response time is quick, she never gives a straight answer. She wants you to "review the notes", so if you ask a yes or no question, you can expect an answer that is neither yes or no, which is incredibly frustrating.

Worst class I have taken in my four years at UW The homeworks were the most frustrating assignments I have ever had. Even cried a few times out of frustration
I worked longer than any class before and still got a B. For reference Ochem took much less work and i got an A. 
I cant stress enough how awful the class was. It felt like HAZING.

The lectures were decent, the powerpoints were very high quality. The final/midterm was simple if you conceptually understood the practice test. The homework was way tougher than the actual tests. All of the homework answers are online. Learned everything 2 hours before exams and got a decent grade. Final/midterm was open book and internet.

Prof Beyler is very knowledgable and clearly taught us the material. I didn't read the textbook assigned, just used it for the weekly homework assignments. She gives some in-class group HW that you have to be there for, and you won't know when they will be. The lectures were pretty boring, but she was really good at helping outside of class :)
